title: Calories in a McDouble
meta_description: Learn calories in McDouble from McDonald's, with full nutrition facts including protein, carbs, fat, sodium, and quick menu tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard McDonald's McDouble: two beef patties, one slice cheese, pickles, onions, ketchup, mustard, on a sesame seed bun; no customizations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and ingredients; values based on standard U.S. menu. Check McDonald's app or website for latest and regional info.

quick_answer.text: A McDouble provides 390 kcal and 23 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Upgrade to Double Cheeseburger (add one cheese slice)

faqs.q: How many calories in a McDouble?
What's the protein in a McDouble?
faqs.a: About 23 g of protein from the beef patties and cheese.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a McDouble?
faqs.a: Approximately 780 mg, mostly from condiments and bun.

faqs.q: Does a McDouble have trans fats?
faqs.a: Yes, about 1 g per McDouble from the beef and bun.

faqs.q: How do calories in McDouble compare to Big Mac?
faqs.a: McDouble is lower at 390 kcal vs. Big Mac's 590 kcal.
